title: Seagrid
content:
Seagrid is an organization that provides boat alarm solutions for both marinas and private boat owners.

In the mobile app development, I’ve focused on enhancing the user interface, improving the overall user experience, and fixing bugs found in the app.

On the backend, I’ve played a key role in migrating our database from MongoDB to Payload CMS. This included rewriting backend functions to work with Payload and developing scripts for seamless user data migration.

I’ve also implemented new features and improved the existing alarm logic, ensuring reliable and efficient communication between the app and the physical alarm devices.

I’m currently working on rebuilding the app’s structure. This involves redesigning existing components in Figma as well as creating new ones, which I then implement in the frontend code.

Seagrid’s latest feature, Marinas, allows users to join marinas and boat clubs across Sweden within Seagrid’s network. This led my team and me to reconsider the app’s architecture and create a new type of hierarchy by introducing a top-bar navigation.

title: Feelgood App
content:
Feelgood, now part of Finland's largest healthcare provider Terveystalo, is one of Sweden's leading healthcare companies with over 1,000 employees and 155 health clinics nationwide, including 56 branded clinics.

I've worked on their app that serves both businesses and individuals, with focus on frontend development. Following strict design guidelines, I've implemented solutions based on the designer's requirements while ensuring optimal performance.

In this project, I have primarily focused on optimizing components and adding functionality that enhances the user experience across the platform.

title: Aucsome
content:
Aucsome is a platform where users can bid on items, list their own items for auction, and analyze bidding patterns through visual insights.

It was built using Next.js and integrates Recharts for data visualization, ShadCN for UI components, Framer Motion for animations, and the Noroff API for backend functionality.

title: MAI
content:
This project was part of a workshop in Skövde, Sweden, where we gave a talk on the current state of AI—where it was yesterday, where it is today, and answered audience questions on the topic.

My role in this was to build a web application where we integrated AI functionality using AWS Face & Label Rekognition, OpenAI's object generator, and text generator via the Vercel AI SDK.

This was used as part of an AI seminar, allowing attendees to test and interact with the AI-powered features hands-on.

title: Holidaze
content: This project is a venue booking platform built with Next.js, integrating with the Noroff API for venue data and booking functionality. It utilizes several modern technologies to provide a rich and interactive user experience, including OpenAI via the Vercel AI SDK, Google Maps API, Shadcn UI for components, and Framer Motion for animations.

title: JSFW

images.alt: Screenshot of the Img Gallery project

content:
JSFW (JavaScript Framework school assigment), a full-stack web application developed with Next.js, serving as a comprehensive entertainment platform akin to an IMDB clone. Users can seamlessly browse an extensive database of movies and series, explore detailed information, and save their favorite titles to a personalized watchlist for later viewing.

Beyond media browsing, the platform features a robust blog section where users can publish their own articles, fostering a community for shared insights and discussions on various entertainment topics.

The application leverages a powerful tech stack including Next.js for server-side rendering and API routes, TypeScript for type safety, Uploadthing for efficient file uploads, Shadcn UI for beautiful and accessible components, Clerk for secure user authentication, and Supabase for its backend database and authentication services. Framer Motion is integrated to deliver smooth and engaging UI animations, enhancing the overall user experience.
